alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 2:04PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect southeastern Aroostook County... At 202 PM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Dudley Township to Smyrna Mills to near Island Falls...and moving east AT 25 MPH. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Smyrna, Amity, Dudley Township, Cary Plantation, Smyrna Mills, Sherman Station, Littleton, Linneus, Monticello, Oakfield, New Limerick, Ludlow, Merrill, Crystal, Cary and Dyer Brook. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 267 and 304. US Highway 1 between North Amity and Monticello. State Highway 11 near Sherman Station. * Winds in excess of 25 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile at times in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
